name: Overseas Programs Special Bilateral Projects
objective: To increase mutual understanding and knowledge between the people of the United States and those in other countries by offering qualified U.S. educators opportunities to participate in short-term study seminars abroad on topics in the social sciences and the humanities.
beneficiary_types: Specialized group (e.g. health professionals, students, veterans)
applicant_types: Specialized group (e.g. health professionals, students, veterans)

results.description: No Current Data Available. No Current Data Available.
Funded programs in Argentina/Brazil, Jordan, and Mexico.
Funded programs in Colombia, Finland, and Thailand.

authorizations.text: 102(b)(6), Mutual Educational and Cultural Exchange Act of 1961, as amended. Pub. L. 87, 256.

rules_regulations: Education Department General Administrative Regulations.  Program announcements and related information are available from the Office of International and Foreign Language Education within the Office of Postsecondary Education, Department of Education.
